page.title: 15HOYS MONUMENT
page.content: Hoy's Monument is a column 72 ft high placed on St.Catherines Down.It was erected by Sir Michael Hoy,in memory of Tsar Alexander of Russia's visit to the Island in 1816.Later it was used as a memorial to the dead of the Crimean War. Gotten Manor is one of the last 'one floor' houses left on the Island.This house was probably built near the end of the 13th century.In a document dated 1305,it consisted of a 'hall,a grange,an oxstall,half an acre of garden,a dovecote,30 acres of arable land and 20 acres of pasture.It lies at the foot of St.Catherine's Down. Gotten Manor is now owned,as a private house by Mr.and Mrs.Street.Nowadays it consists of half an acre of garden,a greenhouse,an old stock yard,and some barns.
